= Book source code =
<img src="http://gwt-gae-book.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/images/digital_dreams.jpg" border="0"  align="right" />
[http://code.google.com/p/gwt-gae-book/source/checkout Checkout the source code] for this book. You will find 
 * environmentSetup.sh - bash script to setup your development environment on Fedora Linux OS. After running it you just need to install Google plugin in Eclipse. 
 * template.tgz - archive of a template project which contains the most common libraries you'll use
 * createProject.sh - bash script to create a new project from the above template. Usage:
{{{
createProject.sh com.your.projectname
}}}
 When done, use File > Import > Existing Projects from Eclipse.
 * createProject.bat - MS windows script to create a new project from the above template. TODO somebody please build this and send it to be included. Until then just unpack the archive and use it as it is.

= What's inside the template project =
You can use the template project every time you start a new application. It contains a few libraries already setup, such as
 * [http://code.google.com/p/google-guice/ guice] 
 * [http://code.google.com/p/google-gin/ gin]
 * [http://code.google.com/p/gwt-platform/ gwt-platform]
 * [http://code.google.com/p/gwt-log/ gwt-log]
 * [http://code.google.com/p/gwt-dnd/ gwt-dnd]
 * [http://code.google.com/p/gwtquery/ gwtquery]
 * [http://code.google.com/p/piriti/ piriti]
 * [http://code.google.com/p/twig-persist/ twig-persist]

Visit these project sites to find out more about them. Come back to their documentation whenever needed as we progress with our application.
